definition: district magistrate/county magistrate
county
government official/governmental/official/public/organ of the body/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Guan

sentences.english: Also nobody proof, the child does not recognize the father, the county magistrate worried for a while.
sentences.chinese: 既沒有人證明，孩子也不認爹，縣官一時犯了難。

sentences.english: A man committed a crime and was arrested by thecountymagistrate.
sentences.chinese: 有一個人犯罪，被縣官抓來打板。

sentences.english: In the era of Warring States, Ximen Bao was appointed as the county magistrate of Yecheng.
sentences.chinese: 戰國時期，西門豹被派到鄴城當縣官。

sentences.english: Though the county magistrate is a post of seventh rank, after all, it is an official appointed by imperial court.
sentences.chinese: 縣官的官階雖然只有七品，但大小也是朝廷命官。

sentences.english: In ancient times there was a country magistrate who took bribes and practised graft.
sentences.chinese: 古時候有一個縣官，貪污受賄，謀取私利。

sentences.english: Case of the trial magistrate Jiaowu Lin Tong, who try to recapture the girl's husband.
sentences.chinese: 審案子的縣官叫吳林塘，他想辦法抓回姑娘的丈夫。

sentences.english: Originally in ChineseA man committed a crime and was arrested by thecountymagistrate.
sentences.chinese: 有一個人犯罪，被縣官抓來打板。

help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)

my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
